meanings.definition: The act of reserving a place, seat, or accommodation in advance.
meanings.sent1: I made a booking for a table at the restaurant for our anniversary dinner.
meanings.sent2: Her booking for the hotel room was confirmed with a confirmation email.
meanings.sent3: The booking for the cabin in the woods turned out to be a mistake as it was haunted!
meanings.sent4: His booking for the front row seats at the concert made him feel like a VIP.
meanings.sent5: Making a booking for the guided tour made the vacation planning much easier.

meanings.definition: An arrangement for someone to have a seat on a plane, train, or other form of transportation.
meanings.sent1: The booking for his flight to Paris was done months in advance.
meanings.sent2: She missed her train because her booking was for the wrong departure time.
meanings.sent3: The booking for the bus ride to the amusement park was so crowded, they had to stand the whole way!
meanings.sent4: His booking for the window seat on the plane gave him a great view of the city below.
meanings.sent5: The booking for the cruise included a luxurious cabin with a balcony overlooking the ocean.

meanings.definition: The act of recording an offense or violation in an official register.
meanings.sent1: The police officer made a booking for the suspect after the arrest.
meanings.sent2: The booking for speeding was a wake-up call for him to drive more carefully.
meanings.sent3: The booking for illegal parking resulted in a hefty fine for the driver.
meanings.sent4: Her booking for shoplifting was a mistake she regretted deeply.
meanings.sent5: The booking for vandalism in the park was quickly resolved with community service.
